ATTENDEES.Defintion: people who go to a place, event, etc.

BEHOLD.Defintion: to see or look at someone or something

CONCEIVABLE.Defintion: possible to imagine or to believe

CONCRETE.Defintion: clear and certain, or real and existing in a form that can be seen or felt

CONSERVATORY.Defintion: a room with glass walls and a glass roof, usually connected to a house, used for growing plants or for relaxing in

CONTRIBUTORS.Defintion: a person who contributes something, especially money, in order to provide or achieve something together with other people

EN MASSE.Defintion: If a group of people do something en masse, they do it together and at the same time

ERA.Defintion: a period of time of which particular events or stages of development are typical

ERECT.Defintion: to build a building, wall, or other structure

EXAGGERATED.Defintion: seeming larger, more important, better, or worse than it really is

GOT QUITE A TASTE.Defintion: start to like or enjoy something

JEWELS.Defintion: something that is very beautiful or valuable

LEGACIES.Defintion: something that is left after someone or something is gone

LEGACY.Defintion: money or property that you receive from someone after they die

MARVEL.Defintion: to show or experience great surprise or admiration

OUTDONE.Defintion: be superior to in action or performance

PAINTING A PICTURE.Defintion: to describe or show something in a particular way

PRINTING PRESS.Defintion: a machine that prints books, newspapers, or magazines

REMAINDER.Defintion: the part of something that is left after the other parts have gone, been used, or been taken away

SHOW ITSELF OFF.Defintion: to display in a way that tries to catch attention

SHOW OFF.Defintion: to display in a way that tries to catch attention

SHOW THEMSELVES OFF.Defintion: to display in a way that tries to catch attention

SHOWCASE.Defintion: to show the best qualities or parts of something

SHOWING ITSELF OFF.Defintion: to display in a way that tries to catch attention

SPECTACLE.Defintion: an unusual or unexpected event or situation that attracts attention, interest, or disapproval

STATED.Defintion: a condition or way of being that exists at a particular time

SWALLOWED UP.Defintion: to become part of something else

SYMBOLIC.Defintion: a sign, shape, or object that is used to represent something else

THE CHANNEL.Defintion: the piece of water between the UK and France

THE LIKES OF WHICH.Defintion: a person, thing, or group similar in character or quality to the one mentioned

WIDESPREAD.Defintion: existing or happening in many places and/or among many people
